review: Taking notes from Apple the installation is made to be super user-friendly, but if you run into problems there is little to no help. I was able to install everything and get it working for about 10 minutes. The device seems to be unable to maintain a connection to my wifi network.I checked their FAQ, thankfully I have one of the supported routers, they listed an older version of the firmware, which I downloaded and tried and chromecast was even less reliable.From the 10 minutes I used this it seems like my Roku 3 is a far superior device. The form factor is better (this may be small but it's the biggest thing coming off the back of my tv and has tiny cords coming off the back of it, one they don't show in product shots). The only thing my Roku doesn't do better is YouTube, because for some reason they don't have a Youtube station and anyone that makes one gets shut down.But Amazon, Netflix, local media via Plex, and all the rest are done better and more reliably by my Roku.

author: Haw

review: I wish I would have done more research into this before hand. It is no where near the plug and play ease of use as they make it seem. It basicly is just an airplay device unlike others like it that have a remote and apps ... your remote is your device(i.e. phone, tablet) and you stream from it as well which unless you leave your device plugged in will drain the battery fast. This also means you wont be able to use your device while watching a show.The Set up was god awful I am a fairly tech savy guy but wont be getting any IT job any time soon and this thing stumped me. It wouldnt connect to devices it gave all sorts of error messages. after 3 emails and 2 phone calls to tech support a friend finally was able to go into "My Network" and change settings on my router and update with a patch to get it to work, then had issues a week later.If you are buying this as a gift make sure they are tech savy and not your elderly parents or grandparents because they will never be able to trouble shoot the device.
